moves.3. c3 dxc3: Collijn Defense of the Danish Gambit.
moves.4. Bc4 cxb2 5. Bxb2 Bb4+ 6. Nc3 Nf6 7. e: In Batman vs. Himu (http://gameknot.com/analyze-board.pl?bd=7755063&fb=1&mv=17&rnd=0.006407737731933594) white wins.
moves.9. exf6 Qxe2+ 10. Bxe2: Batman used the king.  The bishop seems like the wiser option.
moves.10... d4: I think I prefer gxf6 better.
moves.11. fxg7 Rg8 12. a3 Ba5: I'm partial to Bxc3+ here instead.  Why isn't that knight free?
moves.13. O-O-O dxc3 14. Ba1 Rxg7 15. Nf3 Rxg2: Definitely better than Rxf2.  17. RxRg1, Kf8.
moves.17. Rxg1 Bf5: Mm, better still.  Yes, quite a bit better.
Mm, I'm leaning towards Bf4+, which lets the rook slide across more of the 7th rank unimpeded.
moves.26. h5 Bf5 27. Nd4 Be4 28. f3 Bf4+ 29. K: Ke6 would prevent another check by knight, though Pc6 would be lost.  It is lost anyway, white has two pieces on it (knight and rook).
moves.38. Nf5+: NxPc6 seems like a better idea, but white may see he can stalemate or win Bb3.
moves.38... Ke6: Mm, the loss of Bb3 by Nd4+ will hurt.  The alternative looks like a draw, though.
moves.39. Nd4+ Kd5 40. Nxb3 f6: I think I like Nb6 better.
moves.41... Bc7: This too protects c6, but renders the black rook kind of useless.
moves.61. Nb7+ Kb6 62. Nd6 Nc5 63. Rc3 Rd4: This move will cost the black knight.  What would white WANT to do here?  Nc8+ forces away the king's protection of the knight, while Bh3 covers the white knight.
moves.64. Nc8+ Kb7 65. Ne7: Unnecessary.  Rxc5 was perfectly good right here.
moves.65... Rc4 66. Re3 Rc1+ 67. Kf2 Nd7: Pe5 was lost, indefensible.  But this of course is even worse.
While a5 sacrifices Pb5, it prolongs the game.
